intro: Lactuca sativa subsp. romana, commonly known as romaine lettuce, is a cultivated form of the lettuce plant characterized by its crisp, upright leaves and a slightly bitter taste. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is native to the Mediterranean region. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with rosettes of dark green, elongated leaves. Romaine lettuce is valued for its nutritional content, including high levels of vitamins A and K, and is commonly used in salads and sandwiches. It thrives in cool climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
